result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric M Inyart

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric M Inyart in court.  Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton in court for Eric M Inyart.  Attorney Alexander Geocaris in court on behalf of Dennis Patrick Murphy for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. No objection from the State. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Motion to Adjourn Plea and Sentencing Hearing, filed.

Defendant Eric M Inyart in court with attorney Jaymes K. Fenton.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requested final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Eric M Inyart in court with attorney Jaymes K. Fenton.  Dennis Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant to have medical surgery in early August and defendant is to begin AODA treatment.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

-  signed by the Court (electronically)

-  copies to be mailed to the parties

Atty. Fenton contacted the court and accepted the appointment.

Clerk:  jms
Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Eric M Inyart in court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Alexander James Geocaris, appearing for Dennis Murphy, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defense counsel motion to withdraw; Court is advised defendant no longer qualifies for their representation.
Court grants motion to withdraw.

Court held indigency hearing with defendant.  Statements by the Defendant.  Based upon review of the Defendant's statements made in court, the Court finds that the Defendant is indigent and does qualify for representation at the County's expense. Court will appoint counsel for Defendant.  The Court appoints Attorney Jaymes Fenton to represent defendant at the rate of $100 per hour;  Attorney Fenton NOT present in court but will be contacted by the deputy clerk as to the appointment. 

Court ordered Defendant to contribute to legal expenses at a rate of  $100 per month upon conclusion of this case.  All payments should be made directly to the Clerk of Courts Office.  Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 28.  Order Appointing Counsel to be prepared and forwarded to the court for Judge's signature.  Copies to be mailed to the parties.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Eric M Inyart in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with E. Xiong, X. Xiong

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Eric M Inyart in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Eric M Inyart in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Eric M Inyart appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
    99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
